intro: Cuphea calophylla var. calophylla, commonly known as the flame flower or red cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its unique floral structure attracts hummingbirds and other pollinators, enhancing its ecological value in gardens.
